Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Boidcom> how would you compare the KMD Dex vs Blocknet or Waves Dex?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <polycryptoblog> Currently kmd Dex is being refactored , initial public testing just started.   It is Atomic Swap based like blocknet however order matching is done locally instead of through masternodes .  Also new engine will make it a lot faster . It is mobile ready as well which blocknet isn‚Äôt

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <JM5667> Done locally does that mean centralized? (re @polycryptoblog: Currently kmd Dex is being refactored , initial public testing just started.   It is Atomic Swap based like blocknet however order matching is done locally instead of through masternodes .  Also new engine will make it a lot faster . It is mobile ready as well which blocknet isn‚Äôt)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <chmex> The opposite

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <chmex> Matching on masternodes is centralized to masternodes Bdex does not do that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <polycryptoblog> Every person who uses the protocol generates their own orderbook,  can‚Äôt get any more decentralized than that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> "In a key difference separating Komodo from regular PoW networks, our dPoW consensus mechanism does not recognize the Longest Chain Rule for any transactions that are older than the most recent "backup" of the Komodo blockchain. For conflicts that may arise which refer to transactions that are older than the most recent "backup," our consensus mechanism looks to the backups in the chosen PoW blockchain to find the accurate record." Page 18 Komodo White Paper (re @sharedvalue: I'm writing a end-of-degree project about consensus mechanisms and found out Komodo uses DPoW.
